company_industry: Information Technology & Services and IT System Data Services
description:
**Your role** 




 We are seeking a versatile Backend Engineer to join our dynamic team, contributing to the full software development lifecycle. You will be primarily responsible for backend development, utilizing Java and JavaScript to build robust and scalable services. A key aspect of this role involves designing, implementing, and maintaining efficient data processing. You will further contribute by handling the operational aspects of application deployments, ensuring high availability and performance.
 



  





 Your role requires a collaboration across teams, acting as a crucial bridge between frontend and backend development teams. You will facilitate effective communication and ensure seamless integration of APIs and services. You will participate in troubleshooting and optimizing existing systems and identify bottlenecks in both code and infrastructure. Maintaining and improving application deployments is a critical part of your role.
 



  





**Qualifications** 



* Good understanding of Computer Science fundamentals, preferably a University level degree in Computer Science or equivalent education
* You have many years of experience of building products involving both architectural design, development and deployment, preferably in Java
* You have deep experience in developing server-side Java
* You are experienced with server-side JavaScript in node.js
* Proficient with operations in hosting environments, in particular with container-based deployments and system administration of a Linux stack
* Good understanding of Web Architecture, in particular HTTP and REST
* Knowledge of common data formats such as JSON, CSV and XML
* Experience of Software Engineering best practices such as API design, Continuous Integration, Test-Driven Development, and Design Patterns
* Experience of working in teams and agile projects
* Ability to communicate fluently in English and Swedish



  





**Bonus skills** 



* Experience with ETL processes
* Experience of creating and shipping full fledged software products
* Experience implementing Software-as-a-Service for cloud environments
* Familiarity with W3C Semantic Web technologies and Linked Data (RDF, SPARQL, SHACL) and associated frameworks such as Eclipse RDF4J and Apache Jena



  





**What makes us unique?** 



* Flexible work environment: option for several remote working days per week
* International Team: we’re a mix of languages and nationalities
* Beautiful office with a lake view: the office is located centrally with a view of the lake Mälaren
* Excellent Equipment: we supply you with quality equipment when you work with us. Let us know what you need to thrive and we will get it for you
* More perks & benefits:
* Swedish language courses
* Generous training and wellness allowance
* Free yearly health checks
* Company bike you can use
* Company events like ice skating, hiking, canoeing etc.
* We strive for diversity in our team and strongly encourage applicants that are less represented in the tech sector.



  





**About the company** 




 MetaSolutions is a company based in Sweden, dedicated to innovative solutions for advanced data management by interlinking information using semantic technologies. Our vision is to be a leading company in supporting advanced data management processes using our product EntryScape (entryscape.com).
 



  





 The company is today seen as a thought leader within Linked Data solutions in Sweden and other EU countries. Long term customers include the Agency for Digital Government (DIGG) where MetaSolutions has designed and developed the national dataportal (dataportal.se). Today, over 100 Swedish public organizations use MetaSolutions’ software EntryScape.
 



 MetaSolutions is a subsidiary of the Swedish Internet Foundation with 120 employees in Sweden. The foundation is an independent, private foundation that works for the positive development of the internet and is also responsible for the Swedish top-level domain .se and the operation of the top-level domain .nu.
 



  





 Everything we do at MetaSolutions is based on Open Source, Open Standards and Open Data. Our customers are mainly located in Sweden, Switzerland, Italy and Germany.

title: Cloud Solutions Architect - Alliances
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing. We are hiring an
 **Cloud Solutions Architect in our Alliances team** 
 to help our biggest partners (companies like Intel, Nvidia, Google, Dell, HP, Accenture, Tata and the like) understand and embrace our open source platform for themselves and their customers.
   

  

 Our worldwide field engineering team apply expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Ubuntu, OpenStack, Kubernetes, AI/MLOps and a wide range of associated technologies. We are experts in the whole open source stack, from kernel to desktop, from cloud to the edge. Our team is also interested in business problems - building things reliably, efficiently and cost-effectively, and we have to learn to speak the language of our customers and their industries.
   

  

 We help global companies embrace public and private cloud infrastructure, cloud native operations, and open source applications. For this team we are looking for several Alliances Engineers to support OEM (hardware manufacturers), GSI (global system integrators), ISV (independent software vendors), Channel partners and Public Cloud alliance partners. You will support various alliances and partners of Canonical to adopt our products and technologies, help business leaders to define joint go-to-market programs with partners from the technical standpoint.
   

  

 We often say that our field engineers have 'the hardest job at Canonical' because customers can ask about any aspect of our solutions and products and expect a thoughtful, well-informed answer. We always want to do the best thing for our partners and customers, regardless of our company interests, and field engineers are the people we trust to ensure that is true.
   

  

**Location** 
 : This is a home-based role, we are hiring worldwide.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Understand Ubuntu, Linux, networking and services in real-world environments
* Architect cloud infrastructure solutions like Kubernetes, Kubeflow, OpenStack, Ceph, and Spark either On-Premises or in Public Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
* Architect and integrate popular open source software such as PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka, Cassandra and NGINX
* Help partners to offer and architect joint solutions utilizing Canonical's technologies on top of the public clouds and in the data center
* Design and publish joint Reference Architectures and perform technical validations with various partners
* Prepare and run onboarding sessions/workshops with various partners' teams to promote Canonical products and solutions


 If you have a passion for the latest open source technologies, cloud-native development, data center technologies such as Kubernetes and computer networking, you will love the Alliances Architect role at Canonical.
   

  

 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Extensive experience with Linux (Ubuntu preferred), Kubernetes, Ceph, software automation
* Experience designing and implementing solutions on top of public or private clouds
* Python and bash understanding, troubleshooting skills
* Fluent written and spoken English
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* High motivation, ability to multi-task and follow-up reliably on commitments
* Interest in customer-facing engagement, including pitching, demonstrating and understanding customer environment and needs
* Interest in new technologies like LXD, Juju and Snaps
* Ability to travel globally up to 30% of the time
* Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or related technical field experience


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Data Architect
description:
**Solution Data Architect – Stockholm (Hybrid)** 




  





**Join a high-impact, fast-growing consultancy reshaping how organizations use data and AI.** 




  





 Are you passionate about data, cloud architecture, and helping organizations unlock real business value through analytics? Do you thrive in dynamic environments where innovation, autonomy, and collaboration go hand in hand? Then this opportunity might be exactly what you’re looking for.
 



 We’re a modern, boutique consultancy specializing in Advanced Analytics and AI, working with leading organizations across healthcare, retail, telecom, and finance. Despite being in scale-up mode, we’ve carved out a strong market presence and are known for combining deep technical expertise with a pragmatic, results-driven approach.
 



  





 We’re now looking for an experienced
 **Solution Data Architect** 
 to help drive success in some of the most data-forward organizations in Sweden.
 



  





**Your Role** 




 As a Solution Data Architect, you will:
 


* Act as a technical lead in data-driven transformation projects, from design to delivery.
* Own the design and architecture of scalable cloud-based data platforms.
* Collaborate closely with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to ensure impactful outcomes.
* Contribute to pre-sales and solution design processes, offering insight and innovation from day one.
* Help implement a cutting-edge data automation framework developed in partnership with industry leaders.



  





**Your Experience** 




 We’re looking for someone who has:
 


* **5+ years** 
 of experience in data architecture or similar roles.
* Expertise in
 **Microsoft Azure** 
 (or similar platforms like AWS/GCP).
* Solid experience building data platforms and warehouses using
 **Synapse, Fabric, or Databricks** 
 .
* Strong data modeling skills (Data Vault, Kimball, or similar).
* A clear understanding of
 **ETL/ELT processes** 
 , from ingestion to reporting.
* Proficiency in
 **SQL** 
 and experience with at least one database platform (SQL Server, Oracle, T-SQL, etc.).
* Familiarity with
 **agile methodologies** 
 such as Scrum.



  





 Bonus points if you have:
 


* Worked with
 **data warehouse automation** 
 tools (e.g., WhereScape, TimeXtender).
* Experience with
 **AI/ML tools** 
 , object-oriented programming (Python, Java, etc.), or dashboarding tools like
 **Power BI** 
 .



  





**Who You Are** 



* A curious and driven problem-solver who sees challenges as opportunities.
* Comfortable taking the lead but collaborative by nature.
* Business-minded - you understand how data creates real-world impact.
* Someone who enjoys sharing knowledge and mentoring others.



  





**What You’ll Get** 



* A say in how we build and shape the company together.
* Work closely with major cloud and data partners on cutting-edge projects.
* Continuous learning through collaborative programs, certifications, and mentorship.
* A chance to work with high-performing teams who genuinely enjoy what they do.
* A competitive salary, great benefits, and lots of flexibility.



  





 Our headquarters are centrally located in Stockholm, but we work in a hybrid model - meeting up for collaboration and energy, but with the freedom to work where you perform best.
 



  





 Sound like your kind of challenge?
 



 Let’s talk - we’d love to hear from you.

title: Digital Workplace Transformation Leader - Sweden
description:
**Job Description**
**Role** 
 – Industry Principal /Digital Workplace Transformation Leader
   

  

**Skill** 
 - Digital Workplace Transformation
   

  

**Location** 
 – Sweden
   

  

**Compensation** 
 – Competitive (including bonus)
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Digital Workplace Advisory Group is a strategic practice unit established to help orchestrate the breadth of Infosys digital workplace service offerings across the technology service-lines, complemented with experience design, digital adoption & learning services to deliver an integrated and human-centric experience to our enterprise clients in their journey to the future of work. This team is responsible for driving integrated Go To Market incubating industry solutions, Managing Analyst Briefings & provide technology advisory services to Client execs in their digital transformation of workplace.
   

  

**Your role**
 In the role of Industry Principal, you would be part of team of digital workplace transformation leaders and evangelists on future of work who specialize in leading organizations through digital workplace transformation by leveraging emerging workplace technologies. You will work on customer engagements to define, sell and guide customers on initiatives in the areas of digital workplace strategy, employee experience transformation, workplace modernization, organizational change and smart workspace design.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
* Provide technology advisory services to Client Executives on their digital workplace strategy & roadmap.
* Lead large digital workplace transformation programs as a trusted Technology advisor to clients working with multiple client stakeholders, business groups and service providers.
* Provide best-fit architectural solutions, technology consultation, assist in defining scope and sizing of work, create technology differentiation to ensure high quality technical solutions and thought leadership for digital workplace.
* Manage a range of stakeholders and subject matter experts to ensure alignment to business needs.
* Liase with various integration forums and internal governance committees
* Strategic and Large deal advisory – Lead integrated solutions for large proposals or client programs (digital workplace).
* Program manage large consulting/advisory engagements for digital workplace.


**Required - Mandatory:**
* Experience in IT .
* A Digital Workplace Technology strategist and evangelist who specializes in leading organizations through digital transformation by leveraging emerging technology and articulating the strategy to deliver new products, business paradigms and ecosystem partnerships that enable growth and increase operational efficiency.
* Well versed with Industry Standards, OEM Standards, and Service Offerings in the “Digital Workplace” domain to be able to provide solution advisory and transformation strategy.
* Experience across the breadth of Digital Workplace Technology domains in Three or more of the below service offering domains –


 Employee Experience, Modern Workplace and Endpoint Management, Digital Collaboration (Team Collaboration , Cloud Voice & Meeting & Collaborative Apps ), DaaS & Device lifecycle Management (Modern device and endpoint management, Cloud Virtual Desktops, Device Analytics & experience management ), Connected Workspaces ( IoT, AR/VR ), Workplace Security), Digital Adoption & Change Management ( incl. Workplace Analytics), Service desk & experience, ( incl. Conversational AI & Automation).
   

  

**Personal**
 Besides the professional qualifications of the candidates, we place great importance in addition to various forms personality profile. These include:
   

  

* Excellent in Verbal, written communication.
* Strong stakeholder management and negotiation skills to be able to influence or manage difficult stakeholders both internal and external – partners, service providers and customers.
* Willingness and flexibility to learn new technologies (learnability, having a pulse on industry trends), scale up quickly and adapt to different roles as the situation demands.


**Why Infosys**
 Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
   

  

 Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.

title: Security Architect
description:
As a Security Architect at Sciber, you will be critical in ensuring the long-term success of our customers. You will work closely with cross-functional teams developing design architectures and operational strategies for cybersecurity solutions that protect our customers from cyber threats. Your expertise will be essential in helping our customers increase their level of protection and making sure they maximize their value from their cybersecurity ecosystem.
   

  

**About The Job**
* Provide expertise and insights for our customers identifying design constraints and ensuring architecture that conforms to requirements.
* Create intelligent operating models to transform and build organizations ready for growth and resilience.
* Stay updated on emerging security threats and technologies to adapt security strategies accordingly.
* Evaluate and advise security tools and technologies.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.


**Qualifications**
* You have Swedish citizenship.
* Excellent teamworking skills.
* Minimum 5 years experience as a Security Architect or similar role.
* You have a long track record of helping clients excel in their cybersecurity journey
* CISSP, CISM, GIAC, SANS or similar is a plus


**Why Sciber**
* Be part of fast-growing company and a team of highly experienced colleagues.
* Work with some of Sweden’s largest companies as customers.
* Develop your skills thru assignments, workshops, trainings and conferences, we invest in our employee’s personal development.
* Working at Sciber is fun; we teach and help each other daily. You will be given many career opportunities to grow and expand, and you will also be able to impact how we deliver services and solutions to our customers.

title: Head of Data Management Division based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support. The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services Directorate – Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO), Data & Information Solutions Department (DIS), Data Management Division (DM) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a
 **Head of Data Management Division** 
**\*.**
**This is a full-time position at grade 7 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark Division Head IT Applications


***Applicants will receive an initial feedback in May 2025.***
***Assessment Centers for selected applicants would take place in June 2025.***
***Panel interviews are anticipated for June/July 2025.***
 Purpose
   

  

 You will be at the heart of the organization's data transformation journey, ensuring everything aligns with business goals, IT strategies, and architecture principles. Your leadership will unlock the full potential of data through strategic guidance, governance, and innovative AI and analytics.
   

  

 You'll develop and implement a comprehensive EIB Group Data strategy that focuses on data collection, reporting, dashboarding, analytics, and AI. This strategy will empower better decision-making, enhance data quality, boost our technology capabilities, and drive efficiency gains—all while helping the EIBG’ business achieve its objectives.
   

  

 Every day, you’ll deliver high-quality, reliable, and "right on time" data services across the EIB Group, enabling teams to take action, make informed decisions, and drive impactful outcomes.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 The Data Management Division’s role is to manage a common foundation of high-quality data to facilitate optimal, secure, and compliant solutions across business areas. This includes managing and governing data collection, reporting, dashboarding, analytics, and artificial intelligence solutions to benefit business services.
   

  

 The Head of Division reports to the Head of Data Information Solution Department and work closely with the other Heads of Divisions in GDO, with business users who are involved in projects and initiatives led by the Division.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Provide input and proactively contribute to the development of an overall IT strategy for the EIB Group, ensuring alignment with the organization's business strategy and external IT trends and developments. Develop and refine policies for the data management domain.
* Drive data-driven decision-making by collaborating with IT teams and business units.
* Ensure data security, privacy, and regulatory compliance by implementing industry best practices, risk assessments, and cybersecurity measures to safeguard sensitive data assets.
* Ensure business value creation and maximize data value by integrating AI and analytics into core business functions to drive operational efficiency and better data valorisation.
* Lead and participate in organisation-wide transversal projects, working groups, internal committees, and fora as appropriate to ensure that best practices are taken into account.
* Recruit, lead, develop and retain highly qualified staff in a complex and fast-paced environment, fostering a high-performance, data-driven culture and ensuring continuous upskilling in emerging technologies while securing diversity and various expertise.
* Monitor and control the implementation of the projects/programmes in Data Management domain to ensuring timely and budget-compliant delivery that brings all foreseen business benefits.
* Provide leadership and guidance on complex issues to Division staff members, ensuring timely resolution of business issues while fostering a collaborative team environment within the division and with key stakeholders.
* Drive and deliver simplification of vendor landscape, shifting towards outcome-based service model incorporating also agile ways of working.
* Stay updated on market trends in the Data Management technology and service delivery models, testing and learning from new capabilities and scaling up competencies.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer science or information technology related domain.
* Minimum 10 years of experience managing large IT projects and supporting production solutions/services, with a focus on Data Warehousing, Data Lakes, Analytics, and AI/ML platforms.
* Experience in managing and coaching substantial internal and external teams, ideally within multicultural environments or international organizations (e.g., contribution to: determining team resources and skills; establishing objectives; assessing performance; delegating and supervising tasks; guiding, motivating, coaching and providing feedback), with a minimum of 5 years of experience in managing large teams.
* Extensive experience in delivering solutions in hybrid (on prem/cloud computing) environments for data warehousing, data lake, analytics and artificial intelligence.
* Business expertise preferably in banking industry (ideally investment banking) delivering data services, demonstrating knowledge and understanding of the financial sector and relevant products including understanding of core business activities of an Investment Bank.
* Demonstrated experience in managing vendors in outcome based and/or outsourcing services model, ensuring seamless collaboration with vendors also in T&M mode.
* Proven record of delivering complex projects and managing a portfolio of projects in ones area, evidenced by tangible results and effective use of various methodologies, including delivery leveraging scaled agile
* Demonstrated experience in managing and delivering daily critical IT services/operations adhering to ITIL best practices, driving preferably ‘shift left’ automation and devsecops practices would be an asset.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*), with a good command of the other. (Knowledge of other EU languages especially French would be an advantage).


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core and managerial competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

 Deadline for applications:
 ****11th May 2025****

title: Platform SW Manager
description:
Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer, and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.
   

  

 We are now looking for a strong leader for our Platform team.
   

  

**Platform team**
 The Platform team develops and maintains our embedded applications running on the System Controller. The team owns everything from the OS and communication protocols to the application layer. We are at the center of a complex system, enabling dairy farm applications from neighbouring software teams, such as milking systems, automatic milking robots, feeding systems, digital services in the cloud and much more. We are a collaborative team working according to Scrum and releasing in a regular cadence.
   

  

 You will be leading the Platform team in the Platform SW Department. The Platform team is in the center of the DeLaval system and collaborates with many different stakeholders, including product owners, architects and members of neighbouring teams.
   

  

**Your Main Tasks Include**
* Leading the software team, including personell responsibility, salary setting and employee development
* Improving ways of working in software development in alignment with other managers and as a part of the SW Guild
* Implementing of the software development process
* Driving the development of new functions together with project managers and product managers
* Owner of the code base within the Platform area
* Partly hands-on development


**Your Profile**
* Leadership experience from one of the following roles: Manager, Project manager, Scrum master or Technical lead
* Relevant university qualification (BSc/MSc) or at least 5 years of relevant work experience in software development
* Proficient skills in software development in one of the following areas: programming, testing, project manager or scrum master
* Preferably experience in developing industrial high-technology products combining hardware, software and an advanced system architecture


 As a person we believe you are a passionate leader. You are a communicative listener eager to develop your employees and your team, your success comes with the team.
   

  

**We Offer You**
 DeLaval offers you to work with high technology solutions in diary business with animal welfare and food safety in the front seat. Visiting and supporting installation and upgrades of farms are promoted to evalute our solutions live. DeLaval is supporting personal development and working actively for your personal career. We support working from home and are today working in a hybrid model.
   

  

 The position will report to the Software Platform Director in Product Development. The location for this position is Tumba, Sweden.
   

  

 Please apply with your CV in English, recruitment is active and interviews will be held ongoing and the position may be filled before the application deadline. So don't wait with your application. We look forward to hearing from you. We do not accept any applications via email. Please apply in this system by using the “apply here” button.
   

  

**For Further Information, Please Contact**
 Roger Jonasson, Director Platform Software , Roger.Jonasson@delaval.com
   

  

 Elin Fagerstedt, HR Elin.Fagerstedt@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Senior Data Engineer
company_industry: Services for Renewable Energy and Software Development
description:
**Join us on our mission to transform the energy sector!** 




  





 I'm working in partnership with one of Stockholm's most exciting start-ups, on a mission to transform how energy assets are utilized, powered, and secured, by bringing the most advanced software and ML capabilities to the power industry for a resilient and renewable-based future! ⚡
 



  





 Founded by senior engineers with backgrounds from some of Stockholm (and the world's 😉) most renowned start-ups & scale-ups, they have developed an intuitive platform that is favoured by leading EV manufacturers, data centres, and power producers, which allows them to optimize how they source & utilize renewable energy, and mitigate the reliance on fossil-fuel backups!
 



  





 With big plans to continually enhance the product and continue to be at the forefront of this space, they are looking to grow the data team, with a Senior Data/Infra Engineer! 🔧
 



  





 This is a permanent role, and an opportunity to join an incredibly talented, forward-thinking and diverse team based in the heart of Stockholm, building a cutting-edge product to energize the transformation of our society! 🌍
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 




  





 As a Senior Data Engineer, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our ML and data capabilities. Working within a talented team of experts, you will:
 



  




* Design and maintain a scalable Data and ML Platform.
* Set and manage data quality standards across projects.
* Build efficient and robust data pipelines.
* Enable data-driven decision-making across the organization.
* Partner with cross-functional teams to deliver insights, forecasts, and optimization strategies for energy assets across Europe.



  





**Must-Have Skills** 




  




* 5+ years of experience in software/data engineering.
* Expertise in
 **Google Cloud Platform (GCP)** 
 and
 **Python** 
 .
* Strong sense of ownership and accountability for your work.
* Ability to work autonomously while effectively collaborating within a flat and agile team.
* Honest, open communication skills, with the confidence to speak up and share feedback.
* Willingness to work on-site in our fantastic Stockholm office.



  





**Nice-to-Have Skills** 



* A good sense of humor to complement our collaborative and curious culture!



  





**What We Offer** 




  




* **Highly Competitive Salary with Equity:** 
 Share in the success you help create.
* **Expert Leadership:** 
 Join a team led by seasoned founders from Sweden’s most prominent tech ventures.
* **Mission with Impact:** 
 Play a direct role in advancing renewable energy adoption and sustainability.
* **Modern Work Environment:** 
 Enjoy a vibrant office culture
* 30 days vacation
* Private heathcare
* Pension
* Gym Card

title: Sr. Sales Engineer
description:
The Sr. Sales Engineer provides pre-sales technical support for all Tungsten Automation products and associated applications. While assigned to a geographic area, Sr. Sales Engineers also collaborate with and backup peers from across the country to provide efficient pre-sales support nationwide.
   

  

**The Sr. Sales Engineer Is Responsible For**
* Preparing standard and custom demonstrations for Tungsten Automation Account Managers and resellers
* The handling of all pre-sales technical issues professionally and efficiently
* Maintaining in-depth knowledge of Tungsten Automation products
* Maintaining a working knowledge of content repositories
* Maintaining a working knowledge of workflow systems
* Ensuring an understanding of key verticals which may include Financial Services, Insurance, Manufacturing, Logistics, Healthcare among others
* Understanding Tungsten Automation's role in supporting business processes, including process assessments, solution development as well as current and future requirements.
* Responding to technical questions in RFI/P/Qs
* Sharing “Best Practices” with other SEs
* Creating and distributing reusable assets for the greater Tungsten Automation community (SEs, AEs, Partners, Marketing etc.). These may include demonstrations, presentations, training materials, whitepapers etc. that speak to thought leadership
* Providing feedback to Product Development regarding new features, improving product performance, and eliminating bugs in the product
* Preparing Tungsten Automation Professional Services for efficient installations – professionally managing the transition from pre-sales to post-sales and staying appropriately involved as the implementation progresses
* Preparing resellers on the technical aspects of selling Tungsten Automation solutions practices and procedures
* Serving as a point of contact for resellers on technical issues
* Responding to resellers requests for pre-sale technical support


**Required Skills**
 Performance is measured by the revenue produced in Tungsten Automation software sales, professional services, and other measurable performance such as: demonstrations, overall sales support, communications, team building, Internal asset contribution and technical leadership. Measurable performance also includes the individuals willingness to:
   

  

* Seek and successfully completes special assignments that enable continued development of his/her technical and/or other job-related skills and abilities
* Regularly go out of his/her way to assist others in the team or department
* Demonstrate openness to feedback and constructive criticism
* Through openness and a flexible style of working with others, help to foster an environment of innovation and creativity
* Assist in maintaining a professional customer environment with positive customer satisfaction
* Make a concerted effort to stay abreast of technological advances and Tungsten Automation's industry overall


 All Tungsten Automation Sr. Sales Engineers regardless of title or level must possess the following skills and knowledge:
   

  

* Communications/Listening Skills


 (Internal & external) – including but not limited to professional writing, problem escalation, and good analysis skills as outlined below.
   

  

* Analysis/Discovery (ROI) -


 Ability to plan for and conduct an Interview with the prospect and/or customer to determine the true business requirements to help build a valid Return on Investment (ROI).
   

  

* Project Management


 Critical path analysis to do risk assessment, problem decomposition and resource estimation. Not a concentrated focus on the tools available to manage projects but a working knowledge of the concepts and how they apply in sales situations i.e. knowledge of the theory, not the mechanics.
   

  

* Sales & Presentation Skills


 Professional presentation skills and experience in team selling, solution selling methodologies, and an understanding of and ability to utilize the Tungsten Automation Sales Process
   

  

* Time Management


 Ability to manage projects including preparation for presentations and demonstrations, training, scheduling, and reporting, and expense processing. This is critical to the success of the sales opportunities as the Sr. Sales Engineer will be required to manage multiple sales campaigns at any given time.
   

  

* Industry/General Technology Knowledge


 A
 ***high level understanding***
 of basic networking and operating system concepts, Visual Basic development / scripting – Ability to develop, test and deploy custom VB/VBA scripts, Java and JavaScript, Industry specific business pain points with active paper processing, storage, and retrieval, and an understanding of J2EE, XML, .NET, OCR, ICR and their use in business processing.
   

  

* Tungsten Automation Technology Knowledge


 A High Level Understanding Of Each Of The Suites That Constitute The Tungsten Automation Product Line And The Ability To Fit The Pieces Together Into The Whole Strategy - By Stating The Requirement For ‘a High Level Understanding’, It Is Defined As The Ability To
   

  

* Position the Tungsten Automation Solution
* Understand the components that make each the solution and why
* Define target markets
* Explain the business value/value proposition
* Describe sample use cases
* Describe reference customers
* Position and differentiate each solution from the other Tungsten Automation technologies
* Identify and Qualify potential opportunities
* Understand the applicability of the technology i.e. where the solution is a good fit and where it is a bad fit
* Deliver high-level presentation and associated conceptual demonstration
* Understanding of the underlying technology concepts.
* Differentiate new product from current product
* General Architecture – understanding of how all of the components fit together technically as well as how they integrate and work with external technologies. This includes an understanding of:
* Foundation technologies including but not limited to XML, IIS, .NET, OCR, ICR, Web Services, Cloud, AI & Machine Learning
* Tungsten Automation Networking Constraints
* Tungsten Automation Components and Services, with a particular focus on Invoice Automation (purchase to pay, e-Invoicing, accounts payable automation).


**Required Experience**
 The qualified applicant must demonstrate knowledge of the roles, responsibilities, processes, tools and techniques used by pre-sales technical support and sales departments, and have excellent people skills, communication and negotiation skills along with the ability to perform professional presentations, and extensive, up-to-date technical knowledge in document management and digital processing.
   

  

**Qualifications Include**
* 7-10 years’ experience supporting a solution sales team in the pre-sales technical role
* Experience leading complex, technical, enterprise solution-based opportunities through the opportunity sales step to successful close
* Bachelor’s degree in information systems, computer science, information technology or a related discipline, or equivalent years of experience.
* Professional presentation experience
* Publishing of white papers, blogs, thought leadership assets
* Business analysis at both the IT and LOB level, including the ability to document the analysis in a useable, shareable format
* Experience working with various partners/channel organization
* Ability to travel 50%
* Knowledge and experience with e-Invoicing and/or accounts payable automation solutions
* Experience in business process management/software industry is a plus.
* A Fundamentals Level of understanding around Cloud, Cloud Services, AI, Machine Learning, and deploying Enterprise Software on the Cloud is highly desirable.


***Tungsten Automation is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Vets***

title: Lösningsarkitekt, Digital Arbetsplats, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Workplace-avdelningen har idag cirka 15 teammedlemmar som ansvarar för PostNords IT-arbetsplats för både administrativ och produktionspersonal. IT Arbetsplatsen är under ständig utveckling och vi strävar alltid efter säkra, pålitliga och användarvänliga tjänster. I vårt arbete håller vi kontinuerligt ett öga på PostNords övergripande vision och strategier för att säkerställa att IT Arbetsplatsen möjliggör och stödjer företagets marknadspositionering.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en lösningsarkitekt som främst kommer att fokusera på att utveckla och stötta våra service managers inom området för digital arbetsplats (enheter och applikationer).
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I rollen som lösningsarkitekt (Engineer) med fokus på enheter och applikationer, kommer du att arbeta med både interna kollegor och externa leverantörer. Kommunikation är viktig för rollen vilket ställer höga krav på språkförståelse vilket omfattar svenska samt engelska.
   

  

**Design Och Strategi**
 Rollen innebär bland annat att arbeta med:
   

  

* Samarbeta nära med service managers och intressenter för att förstå och stötta affärsmål.
* Utveckla framåtsträvande planer för plattformar, enheter och applikationer.
* Föreslå tekniska lösningar för tjänster såsom Citrix, Intune och applikationshantering.
* Rekommendera nya teknologier och branschpraxis.


**Lösningsrådgivning Och Optimering**
* Leda implementeringen av strategier och säkerställa att standarder följs.
* Samarbeta med olika team för att integrera lösningar.
* Ge råd om optimering av teknologier som Citrix och Intune.


**Intressentsamarbete Och Kommunikation**
* Erbjuda expertvägledning och konsultation till service managers och produktägare.
* Översätta intressenternas behov till konkreta tekniska krav.


 Denna tjänst erbjuder dig möjlighet att bidra med din expertis i en strategisk och samarbetsinriktad roll för att skapa en modern och effektiv IT-arbetsplats.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Teknisk expertis inom Citrix, Intune, paketering, utskriftshantering.
* Erfarenhet av outsourcade arbetsmiljöer och förmåga att effektivt samarbeta på distans.
* Problemlösning och analytisk förmåga.
* kommunikations- och interpersonella färdigheter för att effektivt samarbeta med intressenter på alla nivåer.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och leverera resultat inom angivna tidsramar.
* Relevanta certifieringar (t.ex. Citrix Certified Expert - Virtualization, Microsoft Certified: Enterprise Administrator Expert) är ett plus.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med ITIL-processer och ramverk.
* Svenska och engelska, flytande i tal och skrift.


 Vi tror att du är en person som redan har ett stort intresse för området digital arbetsplats. Ditt arbetssätt är inkluderande, strukturerat och ansvarsfullt. Du är kommunikativ, lätt att samarbeta med och säkerställer att ditt arbetssätt skapar och vårdar långsiktiga relationer.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig
   

  

 Vi Erbjuder En Roll Som En Del Av Vårt Dynamiska Team Som Inkluderar Tjänsteansvariga, Ingenjörer Och En Chefsarkitekt. Roller Inom Workplace Är Dedikerade Till Vissa Lösningsområden Och Ansvarar För Att Styra Outsourcade Arbetsplatstjänster Och/eller Några Av De Internt Hanterade Tjänsterna. Det Dagliga Arbetet Varierar i En Internationell Miljö Med Ständigt Nya Utmaningar Och Snabba Beslut. Här Har Du Möjligheter Att Utveckla Kreativa Lösningar Och Arbeta i En Prestigelös Grupp Där Vi Gemensamt Hjälper Till Att Nå Våra Mål. PostNord Är En Av Sveriges Största Arbetsplatser Och Vi Erbjuder Trygga Anställningsvillkor Och Förmåner. Utöver De Förmåner Som Nämns Ovan Erbjuder Vi
   

  

* Hybrid arbetsplats med en nordisk och dynamisk miljö. Se videon om vårt kontor.
* Stora utvecklingsmöjligheter
* Bra försäkrings- och pensionsvillkor
* Friskvårdsbidrag och möjlighet att träna på Arkens gym och inomhuspool
* Medarbetarförmåner genom PostNord Plus - PostNords egen personalstiftelse


 Vi gör vardagen enklare
   

  

 PostNord är den ledande leverantören av kommunikations- och logistiklösningar till, från och inom Norden. Vi säkerställer tillhandahållandet av posttjänster till hushåll och företag i Sverige och Danmark. Vi strävar efter att göra vardagen enklare och mer hållbar för alla som bor och arbetar i Norden. Vi är i ständig omvandling och arbetar konsekvent för att utveckla både vårt erbjudande och våra medarbetare, allt för att uppnå vår vision att vara Nordens favorittransportör. Vi är PostNord - ett fantastiskt företag att arbeta och växa med. Läs mer på postnord.com
   

  

 Ansök
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! Om du har några frågor eller funderingar, vänligen kontakta Susanne Wetterstrand på telefonnummer: +46 72-585 32 85. Vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan då vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande.
   

  

 För fackliga representanter, besök: Facklig kontakt | PostNord
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Software Maintenance Engineer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a Software Maintenance Engineer to…
   

  

 …work in a dynamic and exciting engineering role in Linux-based infrastructure and applications, covering all layers of the stack, including bare metal, virtualization (KVM), containerization (Docker/LXC/LXD), storage (Ceph and Linux filesystems), networking (OVS, OVN and Core networking), OpenStack, Kubernetes and the open source applications running on top of them. It will challenge you to show the breadth of your engineering skills, which will be needed to work on almost any aspect of Ubuntu and the open source applications large enterprise customers run.
   

  

 This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and open source to build a career with Canonical and drive success for our customers, community and the company. If you have an affinity for open source software, great communication skills, and a passion for troubleshooting and fixing issues in technology used by millions across the world, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

 This role deals with critical issues in the open source stack that require upstream bug fixes. Our engineers are able to work productively at any level of the stack including the kernel and in a wide range of languages, to understand and address the software issues at hand. Our group is critical to the success of our customers, partners and Ubuntu itself.
   

  

 You will help with troubleshooting and driving issues to resolution with workarounds, guidance, and bug fixes to be released upstream and in Ubuntu.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This is a remote role, we have teams in all time zones.
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

* Resolve complex customer problems related to Ubuntu, Kernel, Ceph, OpenStack, or Kubernetes and other open source software
* Maintain a close working relationship with Canonical's Field, Support and product engineering teams
* Participate in upstream communities
* Develop bug fixes, backport patches, and work with upstream for inclusion
* Review code produced by other engineers
* Demonstrate good judgment in technical methods and techniques
* Prioritize work and manage your time effectively against those priorities
* Participate in team discussions to improve processes, tools, and documentation
* Maintain clear, technical and concise communications
* Work from home and travel internationally up to 10% of work time for team meetings, events and conferences


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record
* Background in Computer Science, STEM or similar
* Experience with Linux and open source software
* Experience with at least one of Python, Go, C or C++ on Linux
* A drive to learn unfamiliar technology and deep-dive difficult issues
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


 Nice-to-have skills
   

  

* You love technology and working with brilliant people
* You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
* You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
* You have interest in, or willingness to learn about any of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, Kubernetes, OpenStack, Ceph, QEMU/KVM, LXC/LXD,Postgresql, Mongo, Debian packaging, distributed systems


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
**Marketing Automation Specialist med koll på Salesforce Marketing Cloud**
 Vi är mitt i en spännande förändringsresa där vi vill utmana gamla föreställningar om pensionen – och göra det enklare att förstå, engagera sig och fatta kloka beslut om framtiden. Nu söker vi en senior Marketing Automation-expert som vill vara med och skapa smarta, personliga kundresor, bygga effektiva flöden i Salesforce Marketing Cloud och bidra till att vi gör skillnad för både kunder och affär. Hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i ett tvärfunktionellt team med högt tempo, stort hjärta och ett tydligt mål: att skapa värde i varje steg av kund- och köpresan.
   

  

 Du kommer arbeta i Salesforce Marketing Cloud och Data Cloud för att skapa träffsäkra, personliga och effektfulla kommunikationsflöden. Tillsammans med konverterings-copywriters, digitala strateger och utvecklare blir du en central spelare i att driva både affär och kundupplevelse.
   

  

**Det här kommer du att göra:**
* Designa och bygga automatiserade flöden i Salesforce Marketing Cloud
* Segmentera, personalisera och optimera kommunikation baserat på data via Data Cloud
* A/B-testa och analysera insatser för att maximera effekt
* Vara med och utveckla vår strategi för marketing automation och kundresor
* Samarbeta nära sälj, produktägare och andra experter i vårt agila team


**Vi tror att du:**
* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet av Marketing Automation
* Har arbetat i Salesforce Marketing Cloud och gärna Salesforce CRM FSC (Financial Service Cloud)
* Är van att jobba med datadriven kommunikation och ett stort plus om du har erfarenhet av Data Cloud
* Är kreativ och kan skapa och förstå kundresor och hur man kopplar ihop teknik med kommunikation
* Har erfarenhet av digital marknadsföring och förstår hur digital marknadsföring kan stötta affären
* Gillar att ta ansvar, optimera, analysera – och göra skillnad
* Är noggrann, strukturerad och logiskt tänkande


**Vad du får hos oss:**
* En viktig roll i ett team med höga ambitioner, mycket energi och ett tydligt syfte
* Möjlighet att påverka hur vi jobbar och utveckla våra arbetssätt
* Tillgång till modern tech-stack och ett företag med tydlig digital agenda
* En arbetsplats där vi tror på frihet under ansvar, mod och samarbete


**Varför välja SPP?** 
 💚
   

  

 SPP är en del av den nordiska finanskoncernen Storebrand. Tillsammans skapar vi en framtid att glädjas åt genom att vägleda till ekonomiska beslut som gynnar individen, samhället och planeten långsiktigt på ett enkelt sätt. På huvudkontoret i Stockholm sitter vi i nyrenoverade lokaler i nära anslutning till T-centralen med eget gym, träningslokal och en Svanenmärkt personalrestaurang.
   

  

 Vi har en hybrid arbetsvardag med kontoret som primär arbetsplats.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 SPP värdesätter mångfald och jämställdhet och välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrunder, åldrar och erfarenheter. Sista ansökningsdag:
 **30 april 2025**
**Kontaktpersoner**
* Maja Englund, Marknad och kommunikationschef – maja.englund@spp.se
* Lovisa Stehn, Rekryteringsansvarig – lovisa.stehn@spp.s


**Kontaktuppgifter till våra lokala fackförbund**
* Mattias Thunström, Finansförbundet, tel 070-864 41 11
* Anna Peltovuori, Akademikerföreningen, tel 070-648 17 55


*Med kandidatens samtycke görs en bakgrundskontroll under anställningsprocessens slutskede som innebär kontroll av personalia, ekonomiska förhållanden och juridiska frågor. Även CV och annan ansökningsdokumentation kan komma att verifieras.*

title: Fullstackutvecklare
description:
Vi söker en fullstackutvecklare till Tjänsteområde Utveckla boendemiljöer – en roll för dig som vill kombinera teknisk bredd med samhällsnytta i en långsiktig och stabil organisation.
   

  

 Riksbyggen är kanske inte det första bolaget man tänker på när man hör ordet “IT” – men det borde vara det. Som en av Sveriges största samhällsbyggare kombinerar Riksbyggen över 80 års erfarenhet av fastighetsutveckling med ett starkt tech-fokus. Här byggs inte bara hus och boenden – här byggs också moderna, smarta IT-lösningar som stöttar hundratusentals människor i deras vardag.
   

  

 IT-utvecklingen sker nära verksamheten och med fokus på lösningar som faktiskt gör skillnad. Det finns en tydlig ambition att ligga i framkant tekniskt – att bygga nytt, inte bara integrera färdiga lösningar, hållbarhet är också ett viktigt ledord för våra verksamheter. Miljön präglas av stabilitet, långsiktighet och innovation i praktiken.
   

  

 Som arbetsgivare erbjuder Riksbyggen en plats där du kan växa, påverka och bidra – både tekniskt och samhällsmässigt. Det är en arbetsplats för dig som vill göra skillnad, och samtidigt ha tryggheten i ryggen.
   

  

**Hos oss gör du skillnad**
 I den här rollen blir du en viktig nyckelperson i ett affärsnära team som ansvarar för att utveckla och förbättra digitala lösningar kopplade till boendemiljö och bostadsproduktion. Du kommer arbeta med både nyutveckling och vidareutveckling av befintliga system, med stort fokus på integration, användarnytta och hållbar arkitektur.
   

  

 Teknikstacken är Microsoftbaserad och du får arbeta med såväl backend- som frontendutveckling, samtidigt som du är med och formar arbetssätt och lösningar i en miljö där molntjänster (Azure), data och användarupplevelse står i centrum.
   

  

 Det här är en roll för dig som gillar att arbeta både praktiskt och strategiskt – och som trivs i ett team där samarbete, långsiktighet och innovation väger lika tungt.
   

  

 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Utveckla och vidareutveckla lösningar i Microsoftmiljö – både frontend och backend
* Designa och implementera system som stödjer affärs- och verksamhetsmål
* Bygga integrationer för effektivt informationsflöde mellan olika affärssystem
* Arbeta med analys och optimering av kunddata
* Arbeta agilt enligt SAFe
* Samverka med andra IT-team för en sömlös, effektiv IT-miljö


**Du bidrar med din kompetens och ditt engagemang**
**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT/datavetenskap eller motsvarande
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av fullstackutveckling
* Gedigen kunskap inom C# och .NET
* Erfarenhet av frontendutveckling med React 17, TypeScript och JavaScript
* Erfarenhet av anpassning och utveckling av Sharepoint
* God förståelse för API-design och systemintegration
* Erfarenhet av databaser, både SQL och NoSQL
* Erfarenhet av arbete i molnmiljö, gärna Microsoft Azure
* Erfarenhet av agilt arbete och testdriven utveckling
* Talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska


**Det Är Meriterande Om Du Har**
* Erfarenhet från bygg- och fastighetsbranschen
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i större, komplexa IT-miljöer


 Som person ser vi att du har god kommunikationsförmåga och vana att samarbeta med flera intressenter.
   

  

**Förmåner som gör skillnad**
 Hos Riksbyggen får du trygga och generösa villkor. Du har 30 dagars semester och en extra ledig dag där du väljer att vara ledig dagen före julafton eller vid Kristi himmelsfärd. Inför röda dagar arbetar vi halvdag. Du omfattas dessutom av väldigt bra pensionsvillkor.
   

  

 Du erbjuds friskvårdsbidrag, ersättning för läkarbesök samt möjlighet att ta del av Rikskort – ett förmånskort som kan användas i butiker och på restauranger. Vid goda resultat delas även en resultatpremie ut som uppskattning för det gemensamma arbetet.
   

  

 Du kommer att ha din arbetsplats i Riksbyggens moderna och ljusa kontor på Kungsbron i centrala Stockholm – med utsikt över takåsarna och med direkt närhet till alla kommunikationsvägar, bara ett stenkast från T-centralen. Det finns även möjlighet att arbeta i en hybridlösning.
   

  

 Riksbyggen ser mångfald som en styrka och strävar efter att skapa en inkluderande arbetsmiljö. Riksbyggen tillämpar provanställning.
   

  

**Kontakt och ansökan**
 Din ansökan skickar du till oss via www.riksbyggen.se under Jobba hos oss/Lediga jobb senast
 **2025-05-04** 
 . Vi arbetar löpande urval och intervjuer och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, så ansök redan idag!
   

  

 I rekryteringen arbetar vi tillsammans med Ed:Za Group. Har du några frågor eller funderingar relaterade till tjänsten och processen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta charlotte.hoffstrom@edzagroup.se eller tyra.nguyen@edzagroup.se
   

  

**Övrigt** 
 Som anställd på Riksbyggen förväntas du också vara ledamot i någon/några bostadsrättsföreningar, i de fall du har ledamotsuppdrag så utgår ett ansvarsarvode. Klicka HÄR om du är nyfiken på Riksbyggen. Till rekryteringskonsulter, annonssäljare etc. Vi har redan beslutat vilka vi samarbetar med vid rekryteringar samt var vi vill synas. Vi undanber oss därför kontakt från försäljare i dessa frågor.

title: Principal Account Manager,  GenAI Startups
description:
***This job is with Amazon, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Description**
 Join us in shaping the future of Artificial Intelligence! We're seeking a collaborative and innovative Principal Account Manager to nurture relationships with cutting-edge AI startups and help them transform industries through AWS technology.
   

  

 About the Team Our team partners with the most innovative AI startups, helping them build and scale ground-breaking solutions on AWS. We foster an inclusive environment where creativity and collaboration thrive, working closely with various AWS teams to provide comprehensive support to our startup customers.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Build and nurture relationships with startup founders, executives, and key stakeholders
* Develop comprehensive account strategies to drive mutual growth and innovation
* Create and execute go-to-market plans with cross-functional teams
* Guide startups through their cloud journey, ensuring successful adoption of AWS services
* Foster partnerships within the AI/ML ecosystem to expand reach and impact


 A day in the life
   

  

 You'll engage with startup founders and executives, understanding their unique challenges and helping them leverage AWS services to achieve their goals. You'll collaborate with solution architects, marketing teams, and business development professionals to create tailored strategies for startup success.
   

  

**About The Team**
 About AWS
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 10+ years experience in software, cloud, or SaaS sales
* 10+ years business development or partner management experience
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
* Experience selling to C-level executives


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience in AI/ML business development or partnerships
* Knowledge of generative AI technology and market trends
* Track record of developing successful go-to-market strategies
* Experience working with venture-backed startups
* Proficiency in Swedish, Danish, or Dutch
* Advanced degree in business, technology, or related field


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you're applying in isn't listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Backend Engineer - Content Platform
description:
We are looking for a Backend Engineer to join one of the teams working with Content Platform. We are working together in autonomous teams that take full responsibility for their own part of the Spotify ecosystem, including writing code with high standards, hosting our services in Google Cloud Platform, monitoring our services, measuring quality, and guaranteeing service reliability. You will join a team where everyone shares a common interest in distributed backend systems, their scalability and continued development. Together we try to find new ways to create a phenomenal Spotify experience for all our users across the globe.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Be a valued senior member of an autonomous, multi-functional agile team to take on exciting and challenging problems for delivering value to creators.
* Architect, design, develop, deploy, and operate Java services following good design and development practices.
* Design, develop and deploy backend services with a focus on high availability, low latency and scalability.
* Help drive optimization, testing, and tooling to improve data quality.
* Collaborate with engineers, product managers, experts, and business partners, taking learning and leadership opportunities that will arise every single day.
* Work in cross-functional agile teams to continuously experiment, iterate, and deliver on new product objectives.
* Deliver testable, maintainable, and high-quality code and take operational responsibility for the components that you develop.
* Share knowledge, promote standard methodologies, making your team the best version of itself through mentorship and constructive accountability
* Hack on what you want during regular hack days and bi-annual hack weeks.
* Work in an environment that supports your individual growth by providing you with challenging tasks to tackle and the freedom to acquire new skills in hack time, reading groups, lectures, and a variety of internal training courses.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You are comfortable designing, implementing and maintaining systems with Java in symbiosis with a handful of other languages when needed (e.g Python, Scala) and know what clean code is
* You are able to reason about trade offs of different databases and preferably have hands on experience with SQL and No SQL ones
* Our engineers are T-shaped, which means being capable of using the right technology as a tool when needed. If you have some data engineering experience or are keen to learn it - that’s a bonus!
* You are interested in keeping up with current best practices in your areas of expertise
* You are comfortable working with modern infrastructure and tools
* You are comfortable running your software in Linux environments
* You know and care about sound engineering practices like continuous delivery, defensive programming and automated testing
* You enjoy seeing millions of users running your code
* You have a good understanding of data structures and algorithms
* You hold a degree in computer science or similar subject.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Power Platform Konsult
description:
Sii Sverige söker en Power Platform Konsult för att vara en del av vårt Microsoft 365 Competency Center, ett team med över 100 specialister. Hos oss kommer du att arbeta med hundratals utmanande projekt för kunder från olika branscher, från bilindustrin, hälsovård, till högteknologi och mycket mer!
 



 Vi är dedikerade till att stödja utvecklingen av våra anställda. Det är därför vi har ett brett utbildningserbjudande och mentorprogram, samt andra förmåner som pension plan, försäkring, friskvårdsbidrag, regelbundna AW och mer.
 



  





**Som Power Platform Konsult kommer du att:** 



* Leda design och arkitektur av affärslösningar med hjälp av Microsoft Power Platform.
* Samarbeta med verksamheter för att förstå deras krav och översätta dem till tekniska lösningar
* Tillhandahålla expertis om Power Platforms möjligheter och begränsningar och rekommendera det bästa alternativet för att möta affärsbehov
* Säkerställa lösningarnas skalbarhet, säkerhet och prestanda
* Vägleda utvecklingsteam under implementeringsfasen och se till att bästa praxis följs
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste funktionerna och uppdateringarna i Power Platform och relaterad Microsoft-teknik
* Leda integrationen av Power Platform-lösningar med andra system och tekniker
* Genomföra workshops och utbildningstillfällen för kunder och teammedlemmar om Power Platform



  





**Vi letar efter någon med:** 



* Utbildning inom datavetenskap, informationsteknik eller ett relaterat område.
* Erfarenhet som seniorkonsult/arkitekt eller liknande roll, med ett starkt fokus på Microsoft Power Platform
* Djup förståelse för Power Platform (Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate) och dess tillämpning i affärsmiljöer
* Stark analytisk förmåga och problemlösningsförmåga, med förmåga att utforma komplexa lösningar
* Utmärkt kommunikations- och presentationsförmåga, med förmåga att kommunicera tekniska koncept till icke-tekniska parter
* Relevanta Microsoft-certifieringar, t.ex. Microsoft Certified: Power Platform Solution Architect Expert
* Kännedom om andra Microsoft-lösningar och deras integration med Power Platform, som Azure, Dynamics 365, Logic Apps och Microsoft 365 skulle vara en fördel
* Flyttande svenska och engelska

title: System simulation engineer
description:
Etteplan is a leading technical consulting company shaping the industries of the future. We are over 4000 technology specialists within several industries, and we shape the innovations and developments of the future within a global business environment.


We are looking for passionate tech experts. Do you thrive in dynamic, fast-paced environments where innovation is the norm, not the exception? Then this role might be the right fit for you!


Your role



As System Simulation Engineer you will be part of a team working with simulations at Etteplan in Gothenburg. You will work closely with our customers and will be a key person in their product development work. You will get opportunities to work with both assignments at one of our customers and in-house assignments. We have a variety of customers within different industries, which allows us to offer an environment filled with exciting development opportunities.



Your daily work tasks can be:


* Perform system simulations in tools such as GT Suite or AMESim or similar
* Document simulation results in technical reports
* Contribute to the development of Etteplan’s simulation methods


Your profile



We place great emphasis on personal qualities and are looking for someone who wants to grow with us. You are a person who likes to take on new challenges, takes personal responsibility and is used to working towards set goals. You are genuinely interested in technology and stay up to date on trends. You are innovative and like to collaborate with others. Additionally, you are known for your independent, structured and proactive self-starter approach to your work.



To succeed in this role you need to have:


* A master's degree in mechanical engineering, engineering physics or similar
* A minimum of 3 years of experience within system simulations
* Knowledge in at least one system simulation software (GT Suite, AMESim, Dymola, Simulink or similar).



Is Etteplan the next step for you in your career journey? Submit your application today and become a part of our team!

title: Systemingenjör till UMS Skeldar i Linköping
description:
###### **UMS Skeldar utvecklar en obemannad helikopter för att stötta marina, militära och public safety operationer. Vi har en snabb och dynamisk arbetsmiljö med entreprenörsanda. På UMS Skeldar får du den unika chansen att lämna ditt fotavtryck inom vår organisation med snabba reaktionstider och högt engagemang.**

  

Du blir del av System & Software-teamet som består av bland annat mjukvaruutvecklare, systemingenjörer, HMI-designers och testare. Vi jobbar i tvärfunktionella team med fokus på hela systemet inkl. helikoptern, simulatorn, markstationen och länksystemet.

  

I rollen som Systemingenjör hos oss kommer du att jobba med:

* systemdesign, kravnedbrytning, dokumentation, test och verifiering av funktioner som spänner över hela systemet
* systemintegration och hantering av apparater och annan hårdvara
* tätt samarbete inom teamet och med olika avdelningar på företaget, likväl som dialog med underleverantörskontakter
* en komplex och unik produkt där det finns möjlighet att specialisera sig inom ett visst delsystem.


Låter tjänsten intressant? Tveka inte att söka redan idag!  

  



  

  

**Är du den vi söker?**

  

Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och söker dig som har förmåga att bryta ner komplexa problem för att sedan tydligt beskriva detta i krav och designdokumentation. För att du ska trivas så bra som möjligt söker vi efter dig med samarbetsförmåga, ansvarstagande och förmåga att driva sitt eget arbete.


För att lyckas i den här rollen ser vi att du har en högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom relevant ingenjörsområde. Vi söker dig som har arbetslivserfarenhet som Systemingenjör eller liknande roll. Det finns möjligheter att på sikt ta en roll med tekniskt ansvar, så erfarenhet av eller intresse för teknisk ledning är meriterande.


Tjänsten ställer krav på såväl engelska som svenska i tal och skrift.

 **Vi erbjuder:**

  

* en möjlighet att vara en del av ett dynamiskt företag som ständigt utvecklas, där din påverkan spelar en viktig roll
* en högteknologisk produkt som just nu ligger i framkant på marknaden
* en familjär arbetskultur som karaktäriseras av samarbete och högt engagemang
* aktiviteter som främjar både social gemenskap och hälsa, genom vår Festkommitté, Hälsokommitté, Brädspelskommitté och ett Kvinnligt Nätverk.
