title: The mechanical design engineer's dream
description:
#### **About the Position**


Your workplace will be Lyftnord's workshop in Kiruna, where we develop and manufacture safe lifting yokes of the highest quality adapted to customer needs. Here you will be involved in the entire process – from idea to finished product – and see your designs become reality.


We are a growing company with great ambitions and are now looking for design engineers who want to contribute to the development of both our products and the company as a whole.


For those who want to relocate to Kiruna, we offer financial support and fresh accommodation to rent initially.  



  

**Your Profile**
----------------

**Qualifications**

* Civil or university engineer in mechanical engineering (recent graduates are also welcome), or a high school education in mechanical engineering with at least 5 years of experience as a design engineer.
* Experienced in mechanical design and knowledge of 3D software.
* Good problem-solving ability and attention to detail.


Driver's license is advantageous but not required.  



  

**Advantageous**

* Experience with strength calculations and FEM analysis.
* Experience in designing lifting equipment.

Project management skills.  
* 

  

**We are looking for someone who**

* Is a problem solver who enjoys variety and creativity in their work.
* Values a team-oriented commitment where the success of the company and colleagues is in focus – through active support during challenges, while also having the ability to manage own tasks with independence and responsibility.
* Is driven by development and always wants a little more, a little better, a little safer.

Is interested in living in or already residing in Kiruna.  
* 

  

**Job Duties**

* Mechanical design and CAD design for customized lifting solutions.
* Technical problem solving and calculations (training provided if needed).
* Close collaboration with production and customers to realize ideas.

Development of products ranging from small lifting yokes to advanced electrically controlled systems.  
* 

  

**We offer**

* Close proximity to production – we develop and manufacture everything in our own workshop.
* Personal development – individualized development plan and opportunities to grow.
* Attractive benefits – competitive salary, wellness allowance, and private health insurance.
* Flexible working hours – we value work-life balance.
* Fantastic work environment – the workshop is located close to nature with opportunities for activities outside work.
* Relocation assistance – we offer support when moving to Kiruna and housing options for the first few months.

  

Interviews and selection are conducted on an ongoing basis.

title: Software Development Intern
description:
**Job Description**
 The JVM Development Team
   

  

 The Java Virtual Machine Development Team is responsible for the development and maintenance of the virtual execution environment running the Java platform. The team excels in areas ranging from Java Virtual Machine specification adherence, memory allocation, garbage collection, signals, synchronization & locking to JIT compilers, JNI, JFR, and threading. The team works closely with Quality Engineering, Performance Engineering, Customer Support, and other JPG teams to ensure high performance on all supported platforms and stays up-to-date on current and future hardware.
   

  

 The team is looking for interns to join various projects in several areas of the JVM. In this creative role, you will help innovate and implement the next generation of the Java runtime.
   

  

**Requirements-**
 B.S. or above, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent degree.
   

  

* Experience with API design, code development, and debugging in multi-platform environments (Windows, Linux, Mac) is a plus.
* Experience with implementing Java Virtual Machine features is a plus.
* Strong on data structures, algorithms, performance tuning, threading and concurrency.
* Strong on quality, including developing detailed tests for new or changed code.
* C++ programming background and experience is a plus.
* Experience with Java development is a plus.
* Hands-on experience in distributed computing, concurrency programming, performance improvements in a container, cloud or server environment, algorithm design and implementation.
* Familiarity with test automation tools and practices (unit and system level automation) is a plus.
* Experience with designing and developing software programs for near hardware applications, tools, networks etc.
* Proven English written and oral communication skills.


 Career Level - IC0
   

  

**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s challenges. We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 We know that true innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute. That’s why we’re committed to growing an inclusive workforce that promotes opportunities for all.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer competitive benefits based on parity and consistency and support our people with flexible medical, life insurance, and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by emailing accommodation-request\_mb@oracle.com or by calling +1 888 404 2494 in the United States.
   

  

 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer - Hybrid - Stockholm
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**About MAG (in brief!)**
 At MAG Interactive we make mobile games that feel good. As a part of this fun and dynamic industry, it’s our mission to spread joy to players around the world. With over 350 million downloads globally, we credit our success to our awesome colleagues and we hope you'll join the team!
   

  

**The role - Senior Software Engineer**
 In this role you'll champion
 **robust architecture** 
 and
 **clear code** 
 , ensuring
 **well-structured, reusable code** 
 across our projects. As you collaborate with game teams, you'll share valuable architecture and code organization insights, to enhance long-term sustainability across all of our projects.
   

  

 We're all about building reusable code, saving time and elevating the game development experience. This is a unique opportunity to shape the technical direction of a major software project here at MAG, ensuring its stability and scalability, ultimately influencing how we develop our games for the future!
   

  

**Is this you?**
 Do you have a background in software engineering and you have moved into the world of making games? Are you passionate about building projects well, from an architectural perspective?
   

  

 If this sounds like the way you love to work, then read on to see if this could be the role for you!
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* You will be part of the team building a modern UI framework on top of Unity which is used to build all of our games
* Writing clean and maintainable C# code to ensure the scalability and sustainability of our games for the long-term
* Ensuring all code is well written to allow for reusability
* Utilizing strong architectural principles in building new games and maintaining live games (e.g. use of dependency injection, MVC and SOLID principles)
* Contributing to code reviews; and using your experience and understanding to assist and mentor other developers
* Helping to identify and improve the game’s codebase for long term sustainability
* Continuous improvement of the existing codebase and refactoring of legacy code as required
* Working closely with your team as well as with other game teams
* Working closely with the core and game teams to identify and extract reusable code to improve processes
* Contributing to the unique MAG culture including; sharing knowledge, collaborating in our MAG Jams, and helping to maintain our company values (Trust, Curiosity and Drive)
* Opportunities to share your knowledge around sustainable code to other developers across the business


**Your Skills/experience**
* You have extensive experience using C#
* Good understanding of design and architectural patterns such as dependency injection, MVC, GoF design patterns etc
* Experience of working on a range of UI framework projects
* Experience working with a game engine e.g. Unity or Unreal (we use Unity)
* Bachelors or Masters degree in computer science, software engineering or related field, or equivalent training and professional experience
* You have the ability to write well-structured, clean code - you love to find ways to continuously improve the codebase and refactor code where needed
* You are passionate about building easy to maintain and reusable architecture
* Good understanding of coding principles e.g. SOLID
* Experienced in writing automated tests
* You have a solid understanding in data structures, algorithms and software methodologies
* You are a great team player with excellent communication skills and a friendly, positive attitude. You love to both give and to receive feedback.
* You are self-motivated and proactive and able to take the initiative to bring about change
* You are fluent in English (we have employees from all over the world, so we all communicate in English)
* And most important of all…you are excited to work with games!


**Nice to have (but not essential!):**
* Native Android or IOS experience is a plus
* Experience of working in a client-server environment
* Have coded and launched one or more mobile games


**Perks And Benefits**
* Generous company bonus
* Company mobile phone and contract
* Favorable pension and private health insurance package
* Flexible work hours
* Seasonal kick-offs
* Gym allowance
* Generous learning and development budget
* Monthly after works
* Enhanced parental leave
* Company wide carbon off-setting and CSR initiatives


**At MAG, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated and empowered to bring their true selves to work!**
**Our recruitment processes are designed to prevent bias and discrimination against people regardless of; gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, or any other aspect.**
**About MAG**
 We are MAG Interactive – a leading mobile developer and publisher of casual mobile games built on a wealth of creativity and passion. We thrive on creating quality experiences that make our players want to come back for more. And Players agree! Combined, the Company’s games have been downloaded more than 350 million times. We create a good times factory with a global reach that continues to grow.
   

  

 We are all part of a creative, positive and trusting environment where everyone has a sense of ownership over their activities and pride in their work. This open and collaborative working culture at MAG is key to our ability to continuously create top notch games.
   

  

 Every game released from MAG Interactive has reached a multi-million player base and reached the #1 position in its category in a large number of countries. Our games have been selected Best of Google Play, Best Of App Store by Apple and have reached the #1 word game spot in over 100 countries.
   

  

 MAG Interactive was founded in Stockholm in 2010.

title: Game Tools Engineer
description:
As a Game Tools Programmer at Embark you will focus on helping our developers and content creators on Arc Raiders to continuously find ways to make us more efficient in our day to day game development.
   

  

 We believe that great games are made in creative environments, where builds are always playable, and teams can move fast and test as many ideas as possible. In close collaboration with our designers and programmers, you will create easy-to-use tools that enable us to iterate quickly and that encourage experimentation.
   

  

 The games and tooling we're making are built in mostly Unreal, using C++, blueprints and a scripting language called Angelscript.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* By own initiative find opportunities to improve or build tooling to further improve our workflows and ways of making games
* Occasionally assist our team in debugging and fixing complex issues within unreal editor
* Occasionally build content validators to prevent errors reaching the build by checking content validation already in editor


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* A strong background in C++
* Experience with Unreal Engine
* Fluent in English - our team comes from all over the world!
* An interest in computer science and programming as a craft


**Additionally one or some of these would be a great bonus**
* Previously worked with shooter or third-person games
* Ability to speak "design"


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Senior software engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* In-Platform Quality Assurance: Conduct regular audits to maintain data integrity and platform performance.
* Audience Testing: Proactively test and resolve issues before they impact operations.
* Incident Handling: Troubleshoot and resolve incidents.
* CDP Configurations & Governance: Manage configurations, approval flows, and access governance to align with business needs & compliance.
* First-Line Support: Provide hands-on assistance to regional and central teams.
* Documentation & Knowledge Sharing: Maintain clear documentation of configurations, workflows, and troubleshooting guides to support scalability and knowledge transfer.
* Collaboration with Engineering & Data Teams: Work closely with data engineers and analysts to optimize data pipelines, resolve technical issues, and enhance CDP functionality.
* Process Optimization: Continuously evaluate and refine processes to improve efficiency in audience activation, segmentation, and data governance.


**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Hands-on experience with SaaS applications: CDP's, marketing automation tools and data integrations.
* Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills, particularly within GCP BigQuery.
* Experience with CDP Solutions( i.e. Hightouch, Mparticle, Segment, ActionIQ) is highly desirable.
* Understanding how the CDP supports business users in achieving their goals and integrates with key business processes.
* Deep understanding of GDPR and the importance of RBAC with the ability to manage configurations, user access, and platform governance processes.
* Effective communication skills for cross-functional collaboration.


**Application deadline:** 
 14-04-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Full Stack Developer in Salesforce Commerce Cloud
description:
**Join Our Growing Team**
**BE AWAKE FOR THE FIRST TIME IN YOUR LIFE**
**About The Role**
 We are seeking a highly skilled Full Stack Developer to join our team in Köping or in Amsterdam and work on Salesforce Commerce Cloud projects. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in both front-end and back-end development, with a focus on delivering seamless customer experiences. This role requires collaboration with various teams, including marketing, IT, and customer service, to ensure the successful implementation of digital solutions.
   

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain Salesforce Commerce Cloud applications.
* Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and implement necessary security measures.
* Work closely with the Salesforce Marketing Cloud and Salesforce Core teams to deliver integrated solutions.
* Participate in code reviews, testing, and debugging to ensure high-quality code.
* Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior developers.
* Collaborate with team members to achieve project goals and deliverables.


**Skills And Requirements**
* Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer with a focus on Salesforce Commerce Cloud.
* Proficiency in Mulesoft for system integration.
* Strong team collaboration and communication skills.
* Experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud and Salesforce Core.
* Knowledge of compliance solutions for data privacy and security.
* Familiarity with front-end technologies such as JavaScript, React, and Angular.
* Experience with back-end technologies such as Node.js and Java.
* Salesforce certifications are a plus.
* Experience working with e-commerce solutions.
* Familiar with Copado for code deployment.
* Academic degree from Computer Science, Information Science, or a related technical field
* Minimum 3 Years of experience in similar position
* Certification as Salesforce developer, or experience considered as equivalent.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken.
* Authorized to work in Europe without the need for employer sponsorship.
* Extensive experience working in Mac environment and on Mac devices


**About Us**
 Since 1852, Hästens Beds has been committed to crafting the best sleep. The skilled craftspeople at our factory in Köping, Sweden, have been refining our work for generations. Every bed is bespoke and made by hand using only the best natural materials. The difference lies in the details and our quest to provide the most restful sleep for people who want to lead a higher quality of life. We are proud to be a world-class international brand, operating in more than 40 countries with over 300 partners in Europe, Asia, America and Africa – and still growing.
   

**Compensation & Benefits**
 We offer a comprehensive and competitive salary and benefits program.
   

 Hästens is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, advancement, or other employment practices. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating and promoting an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
**About Platform24**
 Platform24 is on a mission to unlock the potential of healthcare by creating smooth and accessible healthcare where patients and caregivers are empowered by the most intelligent technology available. We aim to enable AI precision while maintaining a human touch, allowing medical doctors and nurses to focus on what they do best – practicing medicine 🩺.
   

  

 We have an uncompromising focus on making every day better for patients and clinicians and together create healthcare 2.0 🚀.
   

  

 Joining our team as an Analytics Engineer means playing a key role in one of Europe's most innovative health-tech companies. You will have a significant impact and contribute to shaping the future of healthcare. Combining medical expertise with technology crafted by our engineers, we significantly improve healthcare quality and efficiency on a large scale.
   

  

 In this role, you will partner up with the rest of the analytic expertise at Platform24. This team is pivotal in driving data democratization and creating informative workflows within the company. This role spans a diverse range of responsibilities, encompassing tasks from constructing data pipelines and the development of insightful dashboards to actively contributing to advancing our data and analytic products. Beyond these responsibilities, you will elevate the analytical capabilities of other teams, fostering a culture of continuous learning.
   

  

 We invite you to join us on this exciting journey, where your contributions will significantly impact the future of healthcare.
   

  

**To Succeed In This Role, You Should Have**
* Strong understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing.
* Proficiency with SQL.
* Experience creating visualizations using BI tools such as Superset, Metabase, Tableau, or similar.
* Good knowledge of Python is a plus.
* The ability to design and implement robust data pipelines for efficient data processing and experience with Airflow and Spark is a plus.
* Comfort working with version control and CI/CD.
* Professional experience in analyzing large datasets to extract valuable insights for decision-making.
* Strong communication skills for interacting with organizational stakeholders, conveying insights, and empowering users to conduct their analyses.
* Self-driven and possesses a proactive approach to problem-solving.
* Knowledge of statistics is a plus, particularly understanding the difference between correlation and causation and identifying potential lurking variables.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken, is required.


**What's In It For You**
 At Platform24, we recognize the importance of work-life balance and offer flexible working hours to accommodate different life plans. We host Demo & Beers every other week to celebrate our achievements (beers are optional). Regular personal growth and knowledge-sharing sessions are organized, along with other benefits like office snacks, parties, and the opportunity to spend five workdays a year doing voluntary work to help others.
   

  

 Additionally, you will have the opportunity to work with intelligent, friendly, and skilled colleagues from around the world.
   

  

 This position is located in our Stockholm office located at Münchenbryggeriet.
   

  

 We conduct ongoing interviews, so we encourage you to apply soon!
   

  

*We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.*
 Platform24 develops system support for cohesive digital care chains that facilitate increased accessibility, efficiency and medical security. We are the largest company in the Nordic region when it comes to automatic triage for directing patients to the right level of care and the right care unit, even in complex flows along the entire patient pathway.
   

  

 Our customers include healthcare regions, private care providers, and insurance companies.

title: Senior Software Engineer
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer.**
**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
 Are you passionate about developing cutting-edge software that makes a real positive impact on people’s lives? Join our team and play a key role in developing the real-time embedded software that controls multiple axes in our radiation therapy devices to safely deliver radiation to patients.
   

  

 As a
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 , you’ll be involved in every stage of the development lifecycle—requirements, design, implementation, and testing—while leveraging your strong C++ skills to build secure, modern, and maintainable solutions. You’ll be a part of a dynamic team of 15+ engineers, split into two agile Scrum teams, where you’ll contribute to developing new product features for our Linear Accelerator machines and radiation therapy product portfolio. You’ll work across a range of devices, from full-fledged Linux systems to bare-metal microcontrollers, utilizing various communication protocols and design patterns.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
   

  

* Software implementation, primarily in C++, including unit and integration tests
* Designing architecture and creating detailed documentation
* Reviewing code and software related artifacts
* Mentoring colleagues and sharing knowledge
* Understanding and adhering to the Elekta quality system, introducing improvements to its effectiveness.


**What You Bring**
 We are looking for a proactive and collaborative software engineer with a can-do attitude and a systems-thinking approach. Your ability to drive results, collaborate effectively within a team, and contribute to a supportive and fun work environment will be key to your success in this role.
   

  

 We believe you should also have:
   

  

* A university degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience in software engineering within a product development organization.
* Strong C++ skills, with a passion for writing clean, safe, and maintainable code.
* Solid understanding of software architecture for large-scale projects.
* Hands-on experience in Scrum teams, preferably operating under the SAFe framework.
* Interest and ability in mentoring and knowledge sharing.
* Professional proficiency in English.
* Experience in regulated industries, such as medical technology, is a plus.


 Additional merits include experience or strong interest in one or more of the following:
   

  

* Real-time systems
* Control theory, e.g., servo control
* Fieldbus communication technologies (CAN, EtherCAT)
* Board Support Package development (e.g. DMA, UART, USB, Ethernet)
* ZeroMQ, Protobuf
* Unit testing framework, like Catch2
* CMake and build systems in general.
* CI/CD integration
* Linux
* Yocto
* Development of test frameworks, simulators and/or emulators.


**Why should you join Elekta?**
 In this role, you will work for a higher purpose: hope for everyone dealing with cancer and for everyone, regardless of where they are in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. Additionally, our benefit package includes:
   

  

* 30 paid vacation days/year, additional 4 Elekta days off /year (plus bank holidays).
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme.
* Private Medical Insurance.
* Lunch Benefit.
* Contribution to wellness activities.
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days a week).


 If you thrive in an environment where innovation, teamwork, and high standards come together to make a real impact, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**Hiring process**
 We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit your application in English via the 'Apply' button.  Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 For questions regarding the role or special assistance, please contact the responsible TA Partner Maria Strelkova at maria.strelkova@elekta.com. Please note that we don’t accept applications or provide individual application feedback via e-mail.
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer**
 We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.
   

  

**About Elekta**
 As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta is a proud innovator and supplier of equipment and software used to improve, prolong, and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders.
   

  

 More than 6,000 hospitals worldwide rely on Elekta technology. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven, and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it's personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combine passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care. We don’t just build technology, we build hope.
   

  

 Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with presence in more than 120 markets and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information about opportunities at Elekta, please visit elekta.com/company/careers.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Hive Streaming partners with 150 of the world’s largest enterprises to deliver exceptional Video Experiences, enabling alignment, innovation, and measurable impact through live video.
   

  

 🚀 During 2023, we started launching our VX platform and next-generation products, aiming to enable superior video experiences to drive change.
   

  

 You will be part of the Video Optimization team- a group with a clear focus and strong value to Hive. The team is dedicated to delivering video streams most efficiently, while providing our customers with the tools they need to ensure an outstanding viewing experience, without overloading corporate networks.
   

  

**About The Position**
 We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join Hive's Video Optimization team. In this role, you will take ownership of complex projects, ensuring the success of live events for our customers by optimizing video distribution.
   

  

 You’ll be part of a dynamic team of four, with colleagues based in both Stockholm and Berlin. Your work will have a direct impact on scalability, reliability, and efficiency, designing the most effective content distribution within customer networks.
   

  

 Beyond development, you will play a key role in driving projects forward, solving intricate support cases, and improving system-wide performance. This is not just about writing code—it’s about shaping solutions that last.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Lead projects from start to deployment, working primarily with TypeScript, JavaScript, and Java to build scalable and efficient solutions.
* Proactively solve challenges rather than waiting for direction.
* Work closely with Fortune 500 customers, defining and delivering scalable solutions to network issues.
* Improve and evolve our video optimization product with a strong focus on doing things right rather than quick fixes.
* Engage with a complex, multi-technology ecosystem, ensuring stability and performance.
* Challenge and refine documentation practices, including traditional system diagrams.
* Set high standards for engineering quality and contribute to the team’s technical direction.


**Tech Stack**
**Backend:** 
 Node.js, Scala, Java
   

  

**Frontend:** 
 TypeScript, JavaScript
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You are a highly experienced engineer who thrives in solving complex technical challenges. You take initiative, drive projects forward, and aren’t afraid to dive deep when needed. We believe you have:
   

  

* Extensive experience in full-stack development, with expertise in Node.js, JavaScript, TypeScript, and Java (experience in additional languages is a big plus).
* A strong ability to navigate and solve complex support cases in large-scale distributed systems.
* Experience working with multiple teams to design and implement high-impact solutions.
* A mindset that values long-term solutions over temporary patches.
* A structured yet adaptable approach—balancing best practices with pragmatic decision-making.
* A strong perspective on documentation, including system architecture and diagramming.
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience.


**We Believe You Are**
* A driven engineer who takes initiative and ensures projects reach the finish line.
* A team player, actively sharing expertise and helping others grow.
* A critical thinker who challenges the status quo and strives for the best solutions.
* Curious, versatile, and always looking to learn and explore new areas that contribute to the whole team and Hive's mission.


 If you’re looking for a role where you can drive impact, take ownership, and work on cutting-edge technology, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**Location**
 You are already living in Berlin (Germany) or Stockholm (Sweden) and see yourself working in that location long-term. Keeping our team together in our key hubs is crucial for maintaining strong alignment, tight collaboration, and driving innovation.
   

  

****Why join Hive?****
* Global Impact: Partner with 150 of the world’s largest enterprises, helping them achieve alignment and measurable success through live video.
* Dynamic Culture: Join a collaborative, fast-paced environment that values execution, innovation, and customer focus.
* Empowered Leadership: Play a pivotal role in shaping Hive’s future while connecting directly with the customers who rely on our solutions.
* Pioneering Innovation: Be at the forefront of building strategic communication tools that empower enterprises to thrive amidst massive change.


 🐶Just a heads up, we're a dog-friendly office (office in Sweden).
   

  

**We hope you are excited about this opportunity and look forward to your application!**

title: Senior Fullstack systemutvecklare Java och Angular
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet som Javautvecklare.
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet av Angular 2+.
* Erfarenhet Docker.
* Erfarenhet av att planera och estimera utvecklingsarbete.
* Tala och skriva flytande på svenska.
* Erfarenhet av agilt arbete.
* Erfarenhet av Frontend JavaScript, CSS/LESS/SASS, HTML5, jQuery.
* Erfarenhet av Git och GitLab pipelines.
* Ha lätt för att sätta sig in i nya verksamheter och lära sig nya miljöer och produkter.
* Erfarenhet av Kubernetes


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av Scala.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 14-04-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Software Support Engineer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a Software Support Engineer to…
   

  

 …work in a dynamic and exciting engineering role in Linux-based infrastructure and applications, covering all layers of the stack, including bare metal, virtualization (KVM), containerization (Docker/LXC/LXD), storage (Ceph and Linux filesystems), networking (OVS, OVN and Core networking), OpenStack, Kubernetes and the open source applications running on top of them. It will challenge you to show the breadth of your engineering skills, which will be needed to work on almost any aspect of Ubuntu and the open source applications large enterprise customers run.
   

  

 This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and open source to build a career with Canonical and drive success for our customers, community and the company. If you have an affinity for open source software, great communication skills, and a passion for troubleshooting and fixing issues in technology used by millions across the world, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

 This role deals with critical issues in the open source stack that require upstream bug fixes. Our engineers are able to work productively at any level of the stack including the kernel and in a wide range of languages, to understand and address the software issues at hand. Our group is critical to the success of our customers, partners and Ubuntu itself.
   

  

 You will help with troubleshooting and driving issues to resolution with workarounds, guidance, and bug fixes to be released upstream and in Ubuntu.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This is a remote role, we have teams in all time zones.
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

* Resolve complex customer problems related to Ubuntu, Kernel, Ceph, OpenStack, or Kubernetes and other open source software
* Maintain a close working relationship with Canonical's Field, Support and product engineering teams
* Participate in upstream communities
* Develop bug fixes, backport patches, and work with upstream for inclusion
* Review code produced by other engineers
* Demonstrate good judgment in technical methods and techniques
* Prioritize work and manage your time effectively against those priorities
* Participate in team discussions to improve processes, tools, and documentation
* Maintain clear, technical and concise communications
* Work from home and travel internationally up to 10% of work time for team meetings, events and conferences


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record
* Background in Computer Science, STEM or similar
* Experience with Linux and open source software
* Experience with at least one of Python, Go, C or C++ on Linux
* A drive to learn unfamiliar technology and deep-dive difficult issues
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


 Nice-to-have skills
   

  

* You love technology and working with brilliant people
* You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
* You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
* You have interest in, or willingness to learn about any of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, Kubernetes, OpenStack, Ceph, QEMU/KVM, LXC/LXD,Postgresql, Mongo, Debian packaging, distributed systems


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Senior Data Engineer – In-House Opportunity | Stockholm or Hybrid (Sweden)** 




  





 🕒
 *Full-time, Permanent* 




 🌍
 *Location: Stockholm (Hybrid)* 




 🗣
 *Languages: Swedish & English required* 




  





 Are you ready to join a company that’s embracing data at its core and driving transformation across a vital industry in Sweden? A well-established Swedish organization operating at scale is looking for a
 **Senior Data Engineer** 
 to help shape the future of their data-driven decision-making - and be part of an exciting digitalization journey that’s just getting started.
 



  





 🚀 Why You’ll Love This Role
 



 This is not your typical consultancy gig - it’s an
 **in-house role** 
 at a company deeply committed to becoming fully data-driven. You’ll have
 **ownership and long-term impact** 
 , working alongside a team that values collaboration, trust, and a strong sense of purpose. Here, data isn’t just support - it’s strategic.
 



  





 You’ll join a
 **flat and empowered team** 
 where your voice is heard and your ideas help move both the team and the company forward. The tech stack is modern, the projects are meaningful, and your work will directly contribute to better outcomes for thousands of restaurants, cafés, and commercial kitchens across Sweden.
 



  





 👨‍💻 What You’ll Do
 



 As a
 **Senior Data Engineer** 
 , you’ll play a central role in designing and implementing smart, scalable data solutions in a fully cloud-native Azure environment. You’ll help the organization leverage data at every level - operationally and strategically - through:
 



  




* Designing and developing data pipelines using tools in the
 **Azure Data Platform** 
 (e.g., Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks, Fabric).
* Building and optimizing robust data models to support business insights.
* Creating and managing ETL/ELT flows that ensure data quality, reliability, and performance.
* Collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders to understand data needs and translate them into elegant solutions.
* Driving innovation and continuous improvement in the data engineering space.



  





 🎯 What We’re Looking For
 



 We’re looking for a self-motivated and curious professional who enjoys autonomy but also values being part of a collaborative, tight-knit team.
 



  





**Must-Haves:** 



* 2–3+ years of experience as a
 **Data Engineer** 
 ,
 **BI Backend Developer** 
 , or similar.
* Solid experience working with
 **Microsoft Azure’s BI stack** 
 (e.g., Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks, Fabric).
* Strong skills in
 **SQL** 
 and Spark (Python or Scala).
* Experience with
 **dimensional modeling** 
 and data warehousing concepts.
* Fluency in
 **Swedish and English** 
 (spoken and written).
* Degree in IT, Computer Science, Systems Science, or equivalent.



  





**Nice-to-Haves:** 



* Experience with
 **Power BI** 
 , or a desire to learn and work with the frontend as needed.
* Familiarity with
 **object-oriented programming** 
 .
* Agile development experience.
* Background working with Microsoft’s on-prem BI tools (SSIS, SSAS, SQL Server).



  





 🌱 A Culture of Growth & Balance
 


* You’ll be joining a
 **data & analytics team** 
 that is central to the company’s digital strategy.
* Strong
 **work-life balance** 
 : flexible hours and remote work options.
* Supportive leadership and
 **long-term stability** 
 with a well-established Swedish organization.
* Opportunities to upskill, explore new technologies, and shape how data is used throughout the business.
* A fun, friendly team culture - people work hard, support each other, and don’t mind a fika (or a friendly football match) together.



  





 ✨
 **Make a real impact - in a real business - with data that matters.** 




 Apply now to bring your experience to a team where your ideas will help drive digital transformation at scale.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Trilogy (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
job_function: Business Development, Engineering, and Information Technology
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Are you the engineer who cringes at inefficient code, gets frustrated with deployment delays, and feels constrained by yesterday's development methodologies? Do you envision a world where AI doesn't just assist coding—it revolutionizes the entire engineering ecosystem? Then we're looking for you.
   

  

 While most development teams cautiously dip their toes into AI waters with basic code suggestions, Trilogy is already swimming in the deep end. We've reimagined software development with AI as the cornerstone—not just for coding, but for our entire product lifecycle. From conceptualization to optimization, AI isn't an add-on; it's our foundation.
   

  

 As our Senior Software Engineer, you'll transform legacy B2B solutions into cutting-edge, cloud-native powerhouses enhanced by AI capabilities. You'll implement sophisticated RAG systems for automated defect identification, develop AI-enhanced features, and ensure flawless deployments. This role isn't for those who prefer theoretical discussions over tangible results—we build, ship, and iterate with precision and speed.
   

  

 If accelerating your career in AI-driven engineering while working with cloud-native architecture excites you, this position awaits. However, if you're comfortable with manual testing, resistant to automation, or prefer traditional development cycles, we suggest looking elsewhere.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Harness sophisticated analysis tools and RAG vector databases to swiftly identify, diagnose, and resolve product defects
* Orchestrate AI development agents to conceptualize, build, and deploy groundbreaking features for cloud-native applications
* Work seamlessly with our international team to create enterprise-level solutions that exceed expectations


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Wrestling with Infrastructure Tedium: We've minimized cumbersome setup and maintenance tasks, allowing you to channel your energy into creative problem-solving and innovation
* Sitting Through Excessive Discussions: We prioritize productive development over prolonged conversations—expect a higher code-to-meeting ratio than you've experienced elsewhere


**Senior Software Engineer Key Responsibilities**
* Create and integrate AI-powered features that optimize workflows and provide service providers with next-generation tools and capabilities


**Basic Requirements**
* Genuine AI-First Philosophy (candidates who view AI as a secondary verification tool rather than a primary development partner should not apply)
* Minimum 4 years of software development experience, with emphasis on production-grade server-side web applications
* Proven track record developing mission-critical B2B software solutions
* Substantial hands-on experience with cloud-native or serverless architectures, particularly in AWS environments
* Demonstrated proficiency with GenAI coding assistants such as Github Copilot, Cursor.sh, or v0.dev
* Verifiable success implementing Generative AI solutions with measurable, significant impact


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

 Crossover Job Code: LJ-3889-SE-Stockhol-SeniorSoftware.030

title: Senior Data Engineer - Analytics Focus
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





 We’re looking for a Senior Data/Analytics Engineer to bridge the gap between building robust data infrastructure and delivering meaningful insights to the business. 
 







**About the Data domain** 








 The Data domain’s mission is to transform Trustly into a truly data-driven organization. We are responsible for every aspect of the data journey, from collection & modeling to analysis and visualization. We provide the whole organization with data and analytics artifacts aiming to improve our decisions, operations and the customer’s experience.
 







 We are currently building a new Data Platform on AWS.
 







**About the role** 








 As Trustly is currently moving towards micro-services we have identified the need of a new data platform, a data hub to cater for operational data needs.
 







 Together with the Data Platform team, you will actively participate in the implementation and the maintenance for this new data platform based on AWS. The goal is to design and build a strong and reliable data foundation that will initially support operational data exchanges and will gradually support our analytics and machine learning use cases.
 




  




**What you’ll do** 
* Design and develop Trustly’s Data Platform on AWS
* Build and maintain batch and streaming data pipelines from internal as well as external data producers
* Work with transformations of data from one or multiple source systems to feed our downstream applications
* Optimize data processes for efficiency and scalabilityImplement data security measures and access controls to protect sensitive information
* Participate in data governance and compliance efforts to meet regulatory requirements
* Provide technical expertise and guidance for critical data projects
* Continuously optimize data architecture to support Trustly's evolving data needs
* Help us identify new use-cases for our data and collaborate with stakeholders from the rest of the organization on how to realize those



  




**Who you are** 
* A Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar field
* At least 7 years of experience as a data engineer/data architect
* Proficient in designing and building complex data pipelines and data processing systems
* Experienced with SQL/NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, Redshift, MongoDB)
* Proficient in building stream processing systems using Kafka
* Accustomed of data governance principles, ensuring data quality, security, and compliance
* Experienced with cloud platforms such as AWS or GCP
* Proficient in Python, SQL, dbt, Airflow, Airbyte, S3, Hudi, Athena, Kubernetes and CI/CD process
* Familiar with self-service reporting and machine learning use cases and their prerequisites in terms of data infrastructure
* Thrive in a fast growing company






  




  






  





**Our Fantastic Benefits**




 🌴
 **20 to 30 days of holiday** 
 (depending on location) to support a healthy work-life balance
 



 🥳
 **Monthly team outing allowance** 
 to enjoy social events with your colleagues
 



 👶
 **Parental leave top-up** 
 additional support for new parents
 



 🥐
 **Daily breakfast and on-site perks** 
 to make your workday smoother
 



 💚
 **Well being support** 
 our health allowance covers gym memberships, massages, and much more to help you feel your best
 



**PLUS** 
 additional benefits designed to enhance your work-life experience!
 







**Shape Your Role and Make an Impact**




 Join a dynamic environment where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously embrace new challenges. We’re looking for dedicated and highly motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy collaborating across different areas of the organisation.
 



 If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you!
 **Apply now and submit your CV in English.**

title: Översättare Engelska till Svenska - AI Tränare
description:
DataAnnotation är engagerade i att skapa kvalitativ AI. Gå med i vårt team för att hjälpa till att träna AI-chatbotar samtidigt som du får flexibiliteten att arbeta på distans och välja ditt eget schema.
 



  





 Vi söker en tvåspråkig professionell för att gå med i vårt team och lära chatbotar. Du kommer att ha samtal på både svenska och engelska med chatbotar för att mäta deras framsteg, samt skriva nya samtal för att lära dem vad de ska säga.
 



  





**Förmåner:** 



* Detta är en heltids- eller deltidsdistansposition.
* Du kommer att kunna välja vilka projekt du vill arbeta med.
* Du kan arbeta efter eget schema.
* Projekt betalas per timme, med start från 30+ USD per timme, samt bonusar för högkvalitativt och högvolymarbete.



  





**Ansvarsområden (både på svenska och engelska):** 



* Komma på olika samtal inom en rad ämnen.
* Skriva högkvalitativa svar när specifika instruktioner ges.
* Jämföra prestanda för olika AI-modeller.
* Forska och faktagranska AI-svar.



  





**Kvalifikationer:** 



* Flytande i svenska och engelska.
* En kandidatexamen (avslutad eller pågående).
* Utmärkta skriv- och grammatikfärdigheter.
* Stark forsknings- och faktagranskningsförmåga för att säkerställa noggrannhet och originalitet.



  





**Not: Betalning sker via PayPal. Vi kommer aldrig att be om några pengar från dig. PayPal hanterar alla valutakonverteringar från USD.**

title: Growth Hacker
description:
Drive the future of medical imaging collaboration! Join Collective Minds as a Growth Hacker to lead data-driven strategies, fuel B2B SaaS growth, and make a global impact in healthcare.
 



  





**Company Overview:** 
 Collective Minds is a leading innovator in medical imaging collaboration, providing a global SaaS B2B platform that enables seamless clinical collaboration, education, and research. We cater to the healthcare and pharmaceutical industries, where trust and long-term relationships are paramount. Our average sales cycle spans approximately six months.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 
 We seek a dynamic and results-driven Growth Marketer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in developing and executing marketing strategies that drive business growth. This individual will play a critical role in our marketing, product, and sales teams, focusing on funnel analysis and leveraging data to optimize our go-to-market strategies.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* **Develop and execute bold, experimentation-driven growth strategies** 
 to rapidly drive customer acquisition, engagement, and retention through iterative, data-backed testing.
* **Leverage an agile mindset** 
 to continuously test hypotheses, learn from failures, and optimize campaigns, ensuring fast pivots and iterative improvements.
* **Own the end-to-end experimentation process** 
 —from ideation to execution—by designing, running, and analyzing A/B and multivariate tests to uncover scalable growth opportunities.
* **Champion a fail-fast, learn-fast approach** 
 , using rapid experimentation to validate new channels, messaging, and acquisition tactics.
* **Use advanced data analytics and BI tools** 
 (e.g., AWS RedShift, PowerBI, SQL) to extract insights, measure impact, and optimize every aspect of the customer funnel.
* **Continuously refine marketing and sales funnels** 
 , optimizing conversion rates and reducing customer acquisition costs (CAC) through iterative testing.
* **Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams** 
 (SDR, product, sales, and customer success) to align growth hacking initiatives with business objectives.
* **Implement multi-channel, data-driven growth tactics** 
 across organic, paid, and viral loops, leveraging SEO, SEM, content, and performance marketing strategies.
* **Stay ahead of industry trends and competitors,** 
 constantly exploring new technologies, frameworks, and methodologies to find innovative ways to hack growth.



  





**Skills & Qualifications** 



* **5+ years of hands-on experience in growth hacking** 
 , with a proven track record of running high-impact, data-driven experiments that led to measurable growth.
* **Strong data analytics skills** 
 , with expertise in
 **AWS RedShift, PowerBI, SQL, and other data analysis tools** 
 to extract insights and drive decision-making.
* **Deep understanding of agile methodologies** 
 , iterative development, and growth experimentation frameworks.
* **Expertise in A/B testing, multivariate testing, and conversion rate optimization (CRO).**
* **Curious, data-obsessed mindset** 
 , always questioning assumptions and driven by a relentless pursuit of scalable growth opportunities.
* **Hands-on experience with SEO & SEM** 
 , leveraging organic and paid search strategies to drive growth.
* **Strong knowledge of marketing and product analytics tools** 
 (Google Analytics, HubSpot, Semrush, Mixpanel, etc.).
* **Ability to work in fast-paced, high-ambiguity environments,** 
 with a strong bias toward action and execution.
* **Excellent communication and collaboration skills** 
 , thriving in an international, multi-cultural team setting.
* **Deep familiarity with B2B SaaS growth cycles** 
 , sales funnels, and demand generation strategies.
* **Fluent in English** 
 (written and spoken).



  




* **Extra points**
* Background within the “high trust” B2B SaaS, healthcare, or pharmaceutical sectors.
* Experience in medical imaging or related fields.
* Collect, organize, and analyze large volumes of structured and unstructured data.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and measure the effectiveness of various initiatives.
* Proficiency in data visualization tools.

title: Chefsingenjör flygplan till Stridsflyg
job_function: Quality Assurance, Product Management, and Engineering
description:
*Nu söker vi en ingenjör som vill vara med och forma både dagens och framtidens stridsflyg. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med spännande och varierande projekt som sträcker sig över hela livscykeln för* 
*stridsflygsystem – från koncept och nybyggnation till modifiering och underhåll.*
**Om tjänsten**
 Vi söker en biträdande chefsingenjör flygplan för att stärka ledningen av vårt systemarbete.
   

  

 Som chefsingenjör får du en central roll i att leda systemarbetet inom grundflygplanområdet för JAS 39 Gripen och kommande generation stridsflyg. Du kommer vara en del av vår produktorganisation och arbeta i både utvecklings- och vidmakthållandeverksamhet.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du vara en nyckelperson i verksamheten och ansvarar för att beredning och arbetssätt för systemarbete är relevant och korrekt tillsammans med dina kollegor. Du arbetar hela vägen från behov och analys till leverans och implementering.
   

  

 Rollen innebär också att du kommer stödja våra ingenjörer och produktföreträdare att arbeta rätt och lösa uppkomna problem. Du kommer också ha frihet att hitta kreativa och hållbara lösningar för vårt arbete.
   

  

 Du kommer vara en del av ett kunskapstungt team som tillsammans använder era kompetenser för att utveckla JAS 39 Gripen och kommande stridsflyg.
   

  

 I din roll som chefsingenjör arbetar du tillsammans med systemingenjörer och andra experter hos både FMV (Försvarets materielverk), industri och Försvarsmakten för att skapa hållbara och innovativa lösningar som möter försvarsmaktens behov.
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm, resor förekommer.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som är civil- eller högskoleingenjör eller har motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt som vi bedömer likvärdig.
   

  

 Du har erfarenhet av tekniskt utvecklingsarbete inom flygområdet. För att lyckas i rollen är det nödvändigt att du har kunskap om regelverk inom luftfartsområdet, militärt eller civilt. Har du produktkännedom om JAS 39 Gripen eller annat militärt flygsystem är det meriterande liksom erfarenhet av INCOSE Systems Engineering (ISO/IEE/IEEE 15288).
   

  

 Vi ser positivt på om du tidigare har kunskap om FMV arbetssätt. Du skall ha god förmåga att uttrycka dig i såväl tal som skrift på svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Personliga egenskaper är av stor vikt för oss. Vi välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter och söker dig som trivs med att samarbeta med andra människor och få både dem och dig själv att utvecklas. Vi ser även att du är självgående, tar egna initiativ och har förmåga att planera och organisera ditt arbete.
   

  

**FMV - Försvarets materielverk**
 På FMV är du med och bidrar till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare. Vi har i uppdrag att förse det svenska försvaret med den senaste tekniken och kunskapen så att de kan försvara vårt land och våra allierade. Tillsammans med kompetenta och engagerade kollegor får du vara med och utveckla och upphandla det som ibland inte existerar än. Du driver utvecklingen, hela vägen från behov till leverans. Från idé till verklighet.
   

  

 Inom Stridsflyg driver vi projekt för vidmakthållande, export och utveckling av JAS 39 Gripen för både Försvarsmakten och exportkunders räkning. Med utgångspunkt från våra uppdragsgivares behov både leder vi och upphandlar utveckling, systemstöd och underhåll av Gripensystemet och dess ingående delar.
   

  

 Hos FMV erbjuds du en trygg anställning med bra förmåner:
   

  

* Kompetensutveckling och karriärmöjligheter
* Flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet till distansarbete i den mån arbetet tillåter
* Tjänstepension och friskvårdsbidrag


 Läs mer om FMV som arbetsgivare och om de förmåner vi erbjuder på vår hemsida: Arbeta på FMV.
   

  

 Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens försvar? Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-05-05.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
* Du ansöker genom att bifoga ditt CV, betyg och intyg på svenska. I ditt CV beskriver du tydligt på vilket sätt du uppfyller efterfrågade kvalifikationer och meriter. För en mer inkluderande rekryteringsprocess tar vi inte emot några personliga brev.
* Vi rekryterar kompetensbaserat och bedömer kandidater utifrån rollens krav på erfarenhet, kompetens och personliga egenskaper.
* Våra fackliga företrädare är SACO Mikael Svensson, OFR/S Madeleine Lithander, OFR/O Henry Joona och SEKO Peter Andersson. Alla nås via FMV:s växel: 08-782 4000.
* Vid frågor om tjänsten kan du kontakta David Helenius-Bylander via FMV:s växel: 08-782 4000.


 För att jobba hos oss behöver du vara svensk medborgare och genomgå en säkerhetsprövning i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi tillämpar provanställning och som anställd kommer du att krigsplaceras utifrån totalförsvarets behov. Ansökningar till befattningen tas endast emot via FMV:s webbplats eller registratur. Vi har gjort vårt medieval och undanber oss därför försäljning av annons- och rekryteringstjänster.

title: Mjukvaruutvecklare – Robotik & Inbyggda system
company_industry: Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, Software Development, and Robotics Engineering
description:
Vill du arbeta med mjukvara som styr högteknologiska industriella robotar? Här blir du en del av ett team på cirka 30 ingenjörer med spetskompetens inom områden som bildbehandling, mjukvaruarkitektur och inbyggda system. Tillsammans säkerställer ni att mjukvaran i vår kunds avancerade maskiner fungerar optimalt!
 



  





**OM TJÄNSTEN:** 




 I rollen som mjukvaruutvecklare kommer du att arbeta med mjukvaran i en 6-axlig industrirobot som verkar i trånga utrymmen och med mycket hög noggrannhet. Du arbetar i robotarmens egna utvecklingsmiljö, främst likt C-programmering, men också med Java i en Linuxmiljö för att integrera mjukvaran med maskinens övriga applikationer.
 



 Du kommer även arbeta i Java för att automatisera testning och simulering. Arbetet innefattar både nyutveckling och löpande förbättringar, samt en del support kopplad till mjukvaran i maskiner som redan är installerade ute på fältet.
 



  





**VI SÖKER DIG SOM:** 



* Har en relevant ingenjörsutbildning i grunden.
* Har kommit i kontakt med robotprogrammering under studierna eller genom arbetslivserfarenhet. Starkt meriterande är om du har 3-5års erfarenhet inom robotprogrammering och/eller inbyggda system.
* Brinner för teknik och att jobba nära hårdvara – och kan ge exempel på det.



**Meriterande:** 



* 2-5 års arbetslivserfarenhet från att arbeta med robotprogrammering
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av inbyggda system
* Tidigare arbete med test, utveckling och/eller produktion



**Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Du är:** 



* Nyfiken och driven att hela tiden lära dig nytt
* Lösningsorienterad och ser möjligheter snarare än hinder
* Ödmjuk och samarbetsvillig i ditt sätt att arbeta



  





**OM ANSTÄLLNINGEN:** 




 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag vilket innebär att du kommer till en början att vara anställd av Friday. Ambitionen från Kunden och vår sida är att du efter ca 12 månader blir direktanställd hos kunden.
 



  





**ÖVRIG INFO:** 




 · Omfattning: Tillsvidare
 



 · Start: Enligt överrenskommelse
 



 · Placering: Stockholm, Norrort
 



 · Rekryteringsansvarig: Anna Persson
 



 · Lön: Marknadsmässig
 



 Ansök genom att klicka på länken nedan. Kom ihåg att vara snabb med din ansökan då vi gör löpande urval av kandidater och att annonsen kan stängs ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.
 



  





**OM FRIDAY:** 




*Genom att vara en partner både till våra kandidater och kunder strävar vi efter att hitta den bästa matchningen. Det gör vi genom att lära känna våra kunder och kandidater på riktigt! Vi ser självklart till att kunskaps- och erfarenhetskrav matchar, men framförallt lägger vi vikt vid samsyn kring värderingar och företagskultur som båda parter värdesätter.* 




*Vår passion är att hjälpa människor till rätt roll, arbetsplats och sammanhang inom IT och teknik. Därför grundade vi Friday med ambition att hjälpa dig till jobbet som ger dig fredagskänslan – varje dag!* 




*Vi riktar oss främst till dig som är i början av din karriär eller studerar vid högskola/universitet inom IT och Teknik.* 




*Vår övertygelse är att människor uppnår sin fulla potential när man ser fram emot att gå till jobbet varje morgon. ”Friday – everyday”, hur låter det?* 




  





  





  





*Sökord: Mjukvaruutveckling, inbyggda system, C-programmering, Java, Linux, robotprogrammering, automatiserad testning, simulering, integration, realtidssystem, maskinstyrning, industrirobotik, produktionsnära utveckling, teknisk support, systemutveckling, bildbehandling, högteknologiska maskiner.* 




*Software development, embedded systems, C programming, Java, Linux, robot programming, automated testing, simulation, integration, real-time systems, machine control, industrial robotics, production-near development, technical support, systems development, image processing, high-tech machinery.*
